entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 10:27AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOODING FROM LAKE DRAINAGE NEAR NUIQSUT... A lake 23 miles west of Nuiqsut is expected to drain rapidly into Judy Creek and Fish Creek sometime in the next two weeks, impacting camps downstream. Water levels are expect to rise 2 to 6 feet over a 12 to 24 hour period once it releases.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 5:57AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ANOTHER HEAT WAVE LIKELY LATE THIS HOLIDAY WEEKEND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK... Widespread hot temperatures are expected to develop again late this weekend across the Inner Channels with highs from the upper 70s into the 80s. Locations away from the water will be the warmest. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 3:20PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Cooler and Breezy 4th of July Holiday Weekend... * A cold front will bring temperatures down to 5-15 degrees below average Sunday and Monday. Highs in the lower to mid 80s are expected in the lower elevations, with upper 60s to lower 70s in Sierra valleys. For many areas this could be the coolest July 4th since 2000. Nights will also be cooler than average, so
entry.cap:areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Mono; Surprise Valley California

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 10:20AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS FOR THE HOLIDAY WEEKEND... Warm and very dry conditions expected over the holiday weekend. An upper-level system and dry cold front will bring gusty winds this afternoon and evening and again tomorrow. The winds, in combination with the warm and dry weather, will result in elevated fire weather conditions across much of the region.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT INDEX VALUES BETWEEN 105 AND 109 DEGREES ARE EXPECTED TODAY... The combination of warm temperatures and high dewpoints will produce heat indices between 105 and 109 degrees today. Residents with outdoor activities planned are urged to drink plenty of water, wear light weight and light colored clothing and take frequent breaks from the heat.
